p: By age group, observed weekly mean hospitalisation rates were highest in persons aged ≥85 years and over with a rate of 64.9 and 162.2 per 100,000 population in influenza and pneumonia, and respiratory diagnosis groups, respectively. This was followed by the 65–84 years of age, with a weekly mean rate of 19.8 and 75.5 per 100,000, respectively. In children aged <15 years, the highest cause-specific weekly mean hospitalisation rate was seen in respiratory diagnoses, with a rate of 47.3/100,000 ( S1 Table).
